Kw7pmZfB-GWFRlc-_VBuUg.text: My mother & I have been here twice since September and have had great experiences... my son & I came I'm August and that went well too - so this review is for 3 visits total since August.  Each time, at various times of the day, we were seated immediately. Staff had always been wonderful and prompt and our food, amazing as expected. The only hiccup was the 1st visit with my son, he ordered a kids pizza and i ordered one of their salads, because I LOVE their salads, but instead, the server had accidentally entered in a Flatbread "small plate", - i let the server know, he left the flatbread on our table & let me know it was comp'd (obviously), and he'd go place the salad order rush. No biggie. The flatbread had mushrooms & spinach & since I love both I tried it and it was so good, I tracked down the server quickly & told him not to worry about ordering the salad, I was fine with the Flatbread & not to comp it. It was a simple mistake that they went out of their way to correct & worked out in my favor because I ended up with something I wouldn't have tried normally, but was so good my mom & I ordered it on our future visits lol along with avocado egg rolls (omg) and other apps. AND the manager came over & they comp'd it anyways. So, no issues there lol. If I'm at the mall, I'll go to CPK any day over the 'other' chain restaurant there.  :-)

photos.caption: Photo of California Pizza Kitchen at Southpark Mall - Charlotte, NC, United States. Avocado Eggrolls

ufL0Kx3w7j6vPKo3tysIgA.text: I was recently diagnosed with Celiacs so while shopping at the mall and hungry my boyfriend and I wondered where we'd eat.  We saw a sign that California Pizza kitchen now had a gluten free menu so we decided to check it out.  As it turns out they had just started the GF menu a week prior.  I had the mushroom pepperoni sausage (GF) and Tim had BBQ chicken (non GF).    They have 4 pizzas that are certified GF and made in their own station to prevent cross contamination.   You can order any pizza with GF crust but they are made in the normal prep area.  They follow the strict guidelines of the Gluten Intolerance Group.   The head chef came out and explained all procedures in making their GF pizza to assure me that there would be no cross contamination and the manager brought my food out, explaining that he had washed his hands and not gone near gluten before serving my food.  I was extremely impressed with their customer service and dedication to providing a safe place to eat for those of us with Celiacs and gluten intolerance, unlike The Cheesecake Factory which has a GF menu but makes all the pasta in the same water, GF and regular, which defeats the purpose of a GF menu for Celiacs.    But back to the pizza!  It was the most normal tasting GF pizza I've had, it was actually doughy and wasn't brittle or super thin.  Even Tim said he couldn't tell it was GF.  I'm definitely coming back!

ZS9n02D30Uib7iL30k6DFg.text: CPK, as some know it, is an upscale pizza chain.  Upscale from say a Pizza Hut but not too upscale, as you can dress casually.  At one time CPK was kind of special.  Now you can get their pizza anywhere from standalone locations, to airports (Chad E.) to your grocer's freezer section.  So, it was on this visit that I decide to NOT get the pizza.  As typical for any place near South Park mall at lunch, the place was packed.  Fortunately, we were seated quickly and promptly waited on.  Upon pursuing the menu and not wanting pizza, I came across my selection...Carnitas Tacos.  The order arrived at the table as two flour tacos w/ not too spicy shredded pork in the middle of each taco.  Topping these tacos was salsa verde, shredded lettuce, cabbage, red onions, and cilantro.  The dish does come w/ avocado but I nixed that topping.  W/ a squeeze of lime, these tacos were pretty decent.  Great flavor and filling w/out leaving you stuffed.  The side of tortilla chips was the only part of the meal that tasted overly processed...like corn flavored Baked Lays.    All of this for $10.75 was a little pricey for two tacos and chips.  But then again, you are in SP and everything here is a little pricey.  I recommend this dish as a great healthy alternative to a cheese laden pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of California Pizza Kitchen at Southpark Mall - Charlotte, NC, United States. Carnitas Tacos w/ chips &amp; salsa

Zadyxqf8iFNDvNsPA-iYWw.text: There for lunch, food ok, not great. Bread for dipping in olive oil, old, stale and hard as a rock. Pizza was good but caesar salad was pathetic. A bit of romaine lettuce and 4 stale tasteless croutons! Won't be rushing back anytime soon.

R1DdiYDTDNVnzE9YRengoQ.text: I love that there are a few restaurant options in Southpark Mall, other than the food court, and California Pizza Kitchen is one and worth enjoying. The food is great and they offer a variety of menu items. We enjoyed the Italian Chopped Salad and White Pizza, both great & fresh! The pizza was cooked to perfection! So, three star you ask...Service. Very slow & the servers seem to be overwhelmed with the amount of tables they have or distracted. It took a long time to order and I had to flag someone down to refill the drinks and really didn't see our waiter until the bill came.

JtrgQpmLcXz-yc3dHL1_jg.text: Disgusting! Pizza salty, undercooked, and over cheesed. Artichoke dip was slightly translucent (gross), also salty and possibly from a can.

UrE7J7xDCtngMVCBpROHrA.text: One of my favorite places in South Park. Always a fun day of shopping, then relaxing at CPK. Cali club pizza is my favorite. Surprised at the ratings cause I always have a great experience!! These guys are great!

Umwa2PYnlb930GnfdQGgOg.text: My mom likes to come here when she visits me in Charlotte, and honestly it's not a bad choice.  They have a decent selection of pizza, pasta, and salads, the seating and orders are always prompt and service is usually pretty good.  Though it's outdoor seating is less than desired, the indoor area is nice.  Prices are reasonable since its in South Park Mall and it's much better than the airport version.  Salads are fresh and customizable.  The pizza cooked with a little burn on them, typical of an oven style.  They have decent lemonade too.  I would recommend this as a valid alternative if you don't want to wait at the Cheesecake Factory or Maggiano's and don't want to succumb to the bourbon chicken offered at the food court.

sLPzpwcTqC1cCyKQvOjimQ.text: You already know what you are getting when you go to a CPK: pretty average food, that everyone will enjoy. Nothing extremely satisfying on the menu, and nothing overly unique. But there is always something on the menu to make anyone happy.

sLNjln4Z7diK0JutlTD7CA.text: I find myself going to cpk because I remember going to one in Virginia with my parents back in the day. In the grand scheme of things, I wouldn't suggest that its pizza is the best or anything, but let's just say that I'm partial to a few things on the menu and that's what keeps me coming back.  First off, I'm a big fan of the BBQ chicken chopped salad. I order it with extra avocado. That's usually my go-to. If I'm in a pizza mood it is usually something with chicken in it or possibly the carne asada. I'm not a huge fan of their appetizers, generally. I like that you can request honey wheat dough.  The service here isn't that great. And the wait times can be outrageous. I've had a couple of really bad experiences with wait times here and can honestly say that you should not come here if you're in a hurry.   But since I am a creature of habit and I've grown to like a few of the dishes, I'll be back. I think the dining experience can be ok here as long as you plan accordingly.

sa3ycWKS_Ut4CkgbPi6MGQ.text: I waited 45 minutes for a table for 6 because my whole party wasn't there yet. Their waiting area is very small & it was crowded. My rambunctious 7 year old couldn't stand there any longer. They would have made more $$ if they sat us. I would have ordered an appetizer & a glass of wine. I got the 1/2 chopped Italian salad. Very good.

zsIqe7d7Hynd3q8DbJk7GQ.text: Decent food terrible service. She forgot to bring me half of my food order, so all I had was an appetizer. Disappointed my pizza was a little burnt and tastes somewhat bland. You could tell my waitress  was tired and ready to go home. I came an hour before closing next time I won't waste my time. I'll stick to Cheesecake Factory

Hc7wEEHBfWR_Peo2gIBRvQ.text: Love their Italian Chopped Salad...and they have a pretty wide selection of choices on their menu....some Mexican flair too!   BUT, we asked to sit on the patio (it was a lovely night out) and they said no. They wouldn't send a server out there to serve us.  No bueno.

TP7upjdLoEVFs-b4C579sA.text: Normally a very good place to dine. I have noticed a change in their ingredients which has diminished the quality they are known. for. The Sicilian Pizza sausage has been changed to a different grade and is not nearly as good as in the past. The other night I had the Thai Pasta with chicken. Where's the chicken? The portion of chicken was extraordinarily small. I was very disappointed.   The service was excellent as usual.

Jw26WD2knwp5ODkfAJXn0Q.text: I visited this location mid-afternoon on a Sunday. The place was dead so I figured I'd be in and out in less than 45 minutes. Ha!  Our waitress took our drink orders and I ordered a water with lemon as I always do. She brought our drinks about 5 minutes later and I noticed she did not bring the lemon. I asked politely if she could bring some lemon and she brought me one lemon slice on a plate....five minutes later.    I ordered some type of salad and specifically asked for no tomatoes on top. After waiting about 20 minutes for this tiny salad, it was delivered to my table with guess what, tomatoes on top! The waitress ran off before I had a chance to say anything. When she eventually returned to refill my water glass, I was picking the tomatoes out one-by-one. She managed to mumble "sorry about the tomatoes" before disappearing again.   Now, heaven forbid I was actually allergic to tomatoes! She made it very clear that she did NOT know how to listen. She did not offer to have the salad remade and I pretty much never saw her until she delivered the check.   I left unhappy and unsatisfied. It's unfortunate that decent customer service is so hard to come by. However, I will not be visiting this CPK anytime in the future.

U9uUv7mJuaPYn4xuCJ37QA.text: Tried their seasonal cheesecake and it was not up to my standard. Black and white it's nothing out if this world.

CS3fzeeQ7MFL2gGaXGD7Gg.text: Why am I never eating here again?  It wasn't the pizza.  It wasn't the strange, obtrusively angled interior.  Or the fact that a million TVs are flashing at you.  It was the horrible service.  I took my mom here, and it's the first time I can recall stiffing someone on a tip. There wasn't even a manager that looked available we could complain to. You would think with the economic crises, people would want to hold on to their jobs -- but it amazes me the utter incompetency I see in the big chain service industry. From the minute we entered, two hostesses who have no clue, to a server who has no clue, to a chef who messes our order up, and actually not receiving our drinks until AFTER the food arrives, then waiting AGES to receive a bill. It's just taking the piss.  Redonkulous.

308R6to5Xl2yC-Q2y1h-Dg.text: My Waldorf salad was the worst one I have ever had at CP.  This one has always been my favorite.  This Salad I got today, had end pieces of the celery, the walnuts were not fresh.  I was not pleased at all.  And you ask, "why did I not tell the server?"  because it would take twice as long to get another salad.

UGCdeWmCsepPq0cdvQf0tw.text: Service was great, but food was not. The bread on my grilled veggie sandwich was mushy. It could have used a light toasting or grilling. The chili relleno was a pre-made, frozen item. The cracker taco pizza looked good, but had way too much ranch poured over the top. There are much better food options in South Park.

kaCsBcRmQ3pEdLISBSgMfg.text: Their tostada pizza is really good and that is what I get every time I go there.  The staff is friendly and the pizza is good.

ZyhvTPA2rtFvk3-XAGBETA.text: Seriously? How do you mess up a taco? My sister and I stopped there for lunch and we both had tacos. She had the fish and I the pork. So you hear pork taco and you think pulled bbq pork with all the fixings right? WRONG! I was presented with 2 of soggiest soft tacos I had ever encountered. But the soggy exterior was not the most offensive part.  I took one bite of the pork taco and thought that the server got my order wrong. The inside of the soggy taco was filled with cubes of greasy fried pork! I thought to myself 'What in the world?' Oh and if the mushy oily texture was not enough of an insult to my pallet, let me add that the entire bite was bland.   The combination of the soggy taco and cubes of greasy fried pork left me speechless and grossed out.  The server came around to see how things were going and I told him I was expecting a different experience with pork taco. He asked me if I would like something else and I told him no. If the cook could destroy something as simple as a taco which is as easy to make as a sandwich, I was not interested in anything else on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of California Pizza Kitchen at Southpark Mall - Charlotte, NC, United States. taco?
Photo of California Pizza Kitchen at Southpark Mall - Charlotte, NC, United States. Greasy fried pork in taco.

HOf6yeldt7ZGexLCf0sDvw.text: I stopped by this location while I was at the mall one afternoon for lunch. I was here for work so I have never been to this location before, but I have been eating at CPK since I was younger. As much as I love this place, I wish they would just come back with their Peking Duck Pizza they used to have!!  This location in particular, I sat outside for lunch and thought the patio was pretty spacious for shopping mall. The view was also nicer than some of the other ones I have been to and you are staring at a parking lot. The waiter I had was very fast and friendly as well, definitely a place I would stop at if I had to get food and be in and out.   I ordered the small plate wedges salad as well as the hawaiian pizza while I was there. The small wedge salad was pretty good, I mean you can't really mess up a salad so I can't complain. The thing I love about the CPK pizzas is the crust, it is not flavorless and always really sweet. Kind of like a Kings Hawaiian roll on a pizza, which is why I make a point to order the pizza everytime I am there. When I ordered this pizza at this location, the crust did not taste like it was supposed to and I was disapointed!! My favorite part is the crust and I did not eat any of it on this visit. The crust was kind of burnt and not very good. I was not very happy, but at least I do not live close to this location

photos.caption: Photo of California Pizza Kitchen at Southpark Mall - Charlotte, NC, United States. wedge salad- small plate
Photo of California Pizza Kitchen at Southpark Mall - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hawaiian pizza

iyMgxHRDKYLWOnyaTJe-3g.text: I have eaten here quite a few times over the last 3 or 4 years & almost never had a bad meal here. Thai crunch salad, sedona tortilla soup, veggie pizza, grilled veggie sandwich, and the Mediterranean small plate are all solid vegetarian choices. I also really like the Mediterranean veggie egg rolls but the price is a little high for what you get so I don't order them often. The flavored teas & lemonades are also good. On my last visit I ordered the white pizza but it was way too salty so I don't recommend it!  Service is alright.. No horror stories but nothing amazing either. Oh well I'm not here for the environment, I just want tasty food & this place has it!

4NyNWdQLonV9jOEHSD8buw.text: Love this place! The Avocado Egg rolls are amazing with the dipping sauce, the BBQ Chopped salad rocks and my favorite pizza is the THAI chicken but the regular stuff is good too.  Great moderately priced spot. I'm a regular. I've noticed a few bad reviews but I figure those are just cranky mall people who are cranky always because CPK rocks!

iShHUnJGi3wS8-8zMvcT0Q.text: I think I walked by this place 100x after checking out some Jordan apparel at the Foot Locker across the hall, so the appeal factor really was not there for some reason.  I finally decided to stop in, though.  The environment was nice and the servers were very friendly.  My favorite part of the meal was probably the complimentary warm bread.  It came with olive oil and had an great crispy crust.    For lunch I got the Waldorf Salad, which was huge, and it was pretty good.  I did not have a chance to try and of their cocktails, but I am not sure if the restaurant feels like the place where I want to go to in order to enjoy some drinks.  For a quick lunch/dinner in the mall after burning up some calories all day, I would definitely recommend CPK.

VJ5iljPC1eTj2YknWUj2CQ.text: If you are craving pizza I think Charlotte has much better spots to satisfy that craving

photos.caption: Photo of California Pizza Kitchen at Southpark Mall - Charlotte, NC, United States. Morrocan chicken salad

vDQJwSTYMzeXNqrp4Iauag.text: I waited 30 minutes for food that was cold. When I say cold I mean like out of the refrigerator cold. I went as far as making the manager touch it. We eat at the one at Lenox mall at least 8 times a month and never see anything like this. This CPK is horrible!!!!! Can't believe I have stopped here on the way back to Atl and waisted all this time!!!  To edit the manager ended up buying our meal and tried to make it right, but after 7 hours in a car and no food since breakfast with 5 more hours to go to get back home....... I would have rather been eating right now and paid than waiting for a recook!  EDIT: I am only going to edit this because the assistant general manager Mr. Bob. Mr. Bob I have to say you change my mind about the CPK here in South Park. Even though they messed up our food the way that you are and how personable you work and how nice you were and taking care of the whole situation plus more made us really enjoy our stay even though we had to wait for our food again. Thank you very much Mr. Bob we appreciate it and we will try again when we come back through.

Tta931hn-OAfW5gnt-H-8A.text: when my friends and I decide to go somewhere to eat I almost always bring up  California pizza at southpark mall but they always shut my suggestion down but as of yesterday I agree with them and now I can see why I went in to get pizza for take out they gave me pizza dough and all the toppings  on a side in little containers do i guess I had to bake the pizza myself I told them I wanted it put together not deconstructed  and tostada pizza with beans and tortilla strips lemon chicken instead of ranch they put mayonnaise on top it was disgusting I think it was done because I complained that pizza was not put together at first .never going back

tJyt4CSB7ukn-xXv2wp4wA.text: Very disappointing and I didn't even eat there. My very first job was a hostess for a CPK and the people I talked to did an awful job. Once I made my selection on the prompt a girl picks up the phone and says, "hello"....hello? I'm not calling your personal phone! How about your name and where I'm calling? Duh! Then she couldn't tell me anything about delivery, said she should though and then transferred me to the guy who would. He was equally underwhelming. I asked if they delivered and he said yes but his delivery guy is out. That was it. So I inquired further...out delivering or out for the night and then he says out for the night. Jesus what is wrong with the youth nowadays. Most seem to have no work ethic and seriously lack common sense and customer service.  UPDATE: Within a business day the store manager reached out to me and apologized for my experience. He said they are currently undergoing a service training company wide. While I applaud them for this corporate wide effort this is definitely something they could do internally. Again, when I worked at a CPK we never had these issues.

ioSpemO5CrmBOPaf3w9NGg.text: It's a large-scale, chain restaurant at a mall with overpriced, albeit, decent tasting food. It had been years since my last visit to a CPK. I used to love their roasted veggie salad and Cali club pizza. I was seated relatively promptly and started perusing the menu. Whoa. The prices tho... I ordered a half salad and a pizza and waited patiently. The food was all ok. Nothing mind blowing. Definitely not good enough to justify the price. The service was fine and the ambiance was fine. Everything was just meh. With the number of amazing local joints in the area dishing up great food with smiles, I don't know why I'd return. Save your dollars and go find a local spot.

FmJyU2bx1Pngabstu-sNog.text: For the love of god can you please learn how to staff! Every time I come there I have to wait when more than half of the restaurant is empty. I ask why and I get "Well we don't have enough servers." This is on a Friday night. It's not that hard. I drove over 30 minutes here last week to be able to sit outside and I get there and they say that they are not seating outside because they don't have enough servers. Such a bogus answer! So I can sit inside but that same server can walk my food outside. Not cool. So they seat us at this booth that is made for children. Not even enough space for 2 pizzas. Not a smart move on their part. I love the pizza here but this "not having servers" is starting to drive me away.

3wkZchET_jtMV-gplsC0bQ.text: Normally, this restaurant has a great reputation.  In Florida, it was one of my favorite places.  Here in the Southpark location in Charlotte, it is actually really bad.  The last few times I went, the service was terrible, the hostesses rude, the food was bland and skimpy on portions, and the atmosphere awful.    The very last time I went, it was so bad, that I emailed the corporate office to let them know they are being represented poorly here in charlotte, and they sent me a couple of free meal coupons. So, this past weekend, I went there to give them one last try.  Upon arrival, I noticed quite a few tables out on their patio, and the day was glorious...74 and totally sunny.  Once inside at the hostess stand, I requested a table on the patio.  She told me they had "stopped seating outside", and it was 1:00pm??  I then said, well I guess we have to sit inside, which she then told me there was a 15-20 minute wait.  When I questioned all of this (since there were no people waiting, and the dining room was practically empty, she said they were short-staffed.    Wow!  Talk about your horrible management!  This is so sad.  I hate to see a good company go down because of horrible management.  Needless to say, I did not stay to eat, and will never return to this location again.  I do wish there was another Charlotte location in the Ballantyne area that had a different manager so they could be as wonderful as they are in other states.

FPpYnURxfi_Rd2PYYt3T_Q.text: I have been here multiple times and usually love it here. However last night I had family in from out of town and we stopped by the pizza kitchen after being told the nicer restuarants around the mall had over 2 hour waits. We were told the wait at the pizza kitchen was only 20 minutes and decided to add our name to the list. We came back 20 minutes later and were told it would be an additional 20 minutes because the current table they picked for us was still seated. Not a problem, we browsed another store and came back to be told the table was STILL occupied. We decided to have a seat and since the small waiting area was full, the hostess told us if we sat right outside they would come call us when it was ready.   After waiting a full hour from our original check in, we went back for the 4th time and the hostess told us our name was called, and when no one claimed the table they sat another party. We immediately asked why no one ever came to call us in the seating area and they simply said we usually recommend someone waits inside the restaurant. No apology, no further accommodations.   Needless to say we left and waited for the buzzer from maggianos to go off and had a MUCH more enjoyable experience.   I hope this was just a service fluke and not an every day thing, but it will make me think twice before returning.

dmzWAn0du6SnC7my014KKg.text: I ate here and I didn't die = 3 stars!  If you can battle the parking lot that was clearly designed by Helen Keller, CPK seems like a reasonable mall choice.  Back by Urban Outfitters and The Container Store, I would park elsewhere and walk through the mall.  Since it is located right next to the food court, parking is awful.  Even at 11:15, folks were starting the Battle Royale for parking spots (and the spots are narrow - my 4runner was taking up the entire spot - I would not park there again).    My lunch dates were already seated when I got there and the friendly hostess showed me to them - on a Friday at 11:15 there was a light crowd, but folks were starting to roll in as we were leaving.    I quickly ordered a diet Coke and since I had checked out the menu online beforehand, I knew I wanted to try the Caramelized Peach Salad which contained field greens and spinach (all tender greens, no tough or bitter), warm peaches, dried cranberries, gorgonzola cheese and toasted pecans with a white vinaigrette (I had them leave off the red onions).  Their salads can be ordered in 1/2 portions, which is what I got ($8), and it was more than enough for a light lunch.  You can add bacon, chicken, etc for an upcharge.  Everything blended well, it wasn't over-dressed, though the vinegar was pretty stout and I would not have been angry about having a few more pecans.  Nice portion with fresh ingredients, it was just right.    Our waiter was very friendly and attentive.  He managed us and a few other tables (one was a large party of clucking females) with ease.  Little one's cheese pizza looked pretty darn good, so I will probably return again (*after* the holidays) to check it out.

drE-fXLymx7O2xZChLZmJw.text: Can't go wrong with CPK. Food is great, price is decent, and the service is always nice. Have to try their pesto chicken pizza if you like pesto sauce. I've been to this location a few times, never had to wait, which is a good thing, and it's just so convenient to grap a quick bite to eat after a long shopping day.

photos.caption: Photo of California Pizza Kitchen at Southpark Mall - Charlotte, NC, United States. CPK Cobb salad
Photo of California Pizza Kitchen at Southpark Mall - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pesto chicken thin crust pizza
Photo of California Pizza Kitchen at Southpark Mall - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ice tea &amp; mojito

qo4JlUFMY-qAUl-SojtAbw.text: Today was exceptionally better than most of our times here. I got the white pizza, minus spinach and add fresh basil & sauce. Super delicious. BF had Italian chopped salad and he swears it's one of the best in Southpark. It's a guys salad ;) free dessert b/c it's birthday month so make sure to sign up for rewards card. Service was ON POINT. Guy super attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of California Pizza Kitchen at Southpark Mall - Charlotte, NC, United States. Italian chopped salad. The &#34;guy&#39;s&#34; salad
Photo of California Pizza Kitchen at Southpark Mall - Charlotte, NC, United States. White pie add basil and sauce, no it&#39;s not a cheese pizza. It has 4 diff kinds!

mrgSseaYtz5Wp6rRXatdBg.text: Right around 3 and 1/2 stars. One of my party sat on a cracked section of the booth, menus were dirty, but bathrooms were a-ok. Definetly over priced for its service. One soda was flat, and the frozen lemonade wasn't even frozen. We said yes to receiving bread and oil to start, and after waiting about five minutes we finally got an update. Apparently they were eating for fresh brad to come out of the oven, but when it finally arrived it was just room temp and the outside was super hard; almost stale. We got a pizza with the thinnest crust, and a section of it was burnt. it seemed like the lunch menu might be better, but not the best or most worthwhile place.

Wl2qK3Gqg3_ZFN3U-473Xw.text: Meh. Just not my favorite ever. It's never been a concept that I particularly enjoy and I especially dislike this location. Being attached the South Park Mall, which I don't tend to enjoy....ever puts a damper on ever having to eat here.   I just don't like their menu. The pizzas are one size and barely serve as pizza in first place. The pies are all one size and lack in execution. The California Club, BBQ Chicken, Margherita, and Thai Chicken all sound good, but tend to be piled with too much and lack the done-ness I like. The only pizza I can really give honorable mention to is the Pear Gorgonzola. It's a nice combo and works rather well.   Worst part? Service. Shocking? Not really. It seems that they hire for ease rather than expertise. Multiple times I've experienced servers who were clueless or just straight up...not there. If you're in a hurry and need to get out quick, good luck. It's the biggest part of the business and also seems to be the part they pay the least amount of attention.   Up the service game, gents. It's what you need.

xA7uek4UDWIDJC48NqupFA.text: Pizza was average. For a premium priced pizza the size of a personal pan pizza, you would expect a little more. Either more taste and less pizza or more pizza less taste. :(

PxSsttR7RFmDZCh_K7D0rw.text: The original BBQ Chicken Pizza eh.  Normally, not my thing, but since it's their specialty, we gave it a go.  I have had it before, but this is the first time dining in.  Overall the pizza was good.  But is it just me or has the pizza gotten a lot smaller, while the price goes up?  Not only that, but now you have to pay an extra $3 for bacon, which was always an included topping.  I wouldn't spend $20 on a pizza that would serve one person of average appetite very often.  Good pizza but terrible value - way overpriced and very small portions.

oWr2mdIPy8NEflR9ho5akA.text: We visited CPK last night because everywhere else in the area had a long wait. Food was decent but nothing impressive. Service was mediocre at best- our server was not attentive. We had to ask for every refill, and I don't remember him ever coming to check on us. When we asked for a second plate of bread (the first plate only had one small piece per person), he seemed annoyed. We finished eating and sat at the table for another 20 minutes. Not one plate was ever bussed from the table. They were out of avocados and several other items that we wanted. We inquired about it and the server said, "Sunday mornings get really busy". If Sunday mornings are normally busy, why not order enough avocados to last all day? (I know the fact that they are out is not the servers fault whatsoever, but he offered no apology for the inconvenience) The manager came over while we were having a big conversation and interrupted the person who was talking, rather than waiting for them to finish. Overall it was a mediocre experience and I will probably not return.

Yb-dZ1cDGqPW4ubB6FyRHQ.text: Horrible service! My daughter and I went for lunch today. The restaurant was not busy. We were seated and ordered our pizza when the waitress came and took our drink order. We ordered a cheese pizza and a mushroom pizza. After 40 minutes of waiting we walked out. I didn't bother to tell the waitress since she didn't bother to serve us. People were seated ordered and were served while we sat and drank water. Never have I walked out of a restaurant in my life but I had enough.

8ohqAQOV40P9o4z5JsX_Rw.text: The California Pizza Kitchen at South Park was below average due to the less-than-good pizza.   I visited for lunch with my family and ordered the hummus appetizer before getting the salad and pizza lunch duo. The humus was good, and the spinach quinoa salad was very good. The spiced pecans and champagne vinaigrette were especially good. My issue was with the pizza. The shaved mushroom and spinach pizza was soggy and gross. I took a few bites and just couldn't eat a mush pizza. I tried a piece of the BBQ chicken pizza as well. While not soggy, the BBQ sauce was sickeningly sweet. I wouldn't have normally dropped a restaurant rating all the way to two stars since a lot of what I had was good, but the pizza was bad and it IS a pizza place after all. Good pizza isn't rocket science. Stop trying to church it up and make a good, simple product.   If you should find yourself here against your will, go with a salad.

1dbemKveduRiHErSIFCfcQ.text: I have been to this location twice in 2017 and I have had pleasant experiences each of the times I've eaten here.  Both times the waiter/waitresses were friendly, and for the most part attentive. Something that stood out to me and left a good impression was that I was greeted by both managers, and one of them specifically made sure I was satisfied with my experience.  All the staff that greeted me had a smile and pleasant demeanor.  The restaurant was clean including the bathroom.  Both times at this location, I have ordered the Carne Asada and was pleased that they have an option to have a wheat crust.  The pizza came out in a timely manner and was delicious.  The steak on the pizza was very tender and full of flavor.  The Carne Asada is my favorite pizza at CPK and I highly recommend it to all you carnivores reading this.

3ZQyRk6VE2bNRFb9QEfMkg.text: I'd not been here in years and was so impressed! My friend is in a wheelchair and they were very very concerned and accommodating that we get the 'right table.' Our server explained a large part of the menu in detail and was very personable! I had the shrimp and zucchini; such a flavorful dish, served hot! He came back repeatedly with ground pepper and Parmesan cheese and then repeated refills of iced tea! There were several families with children but all very well behaved. Five stars for a wonderful dining experience!

cRQEVt_y92-MWhdU5UwegA.text: California Pizza has great food and wonderful service.  We had pizza and a pasta dish prepared to the best of consideration.  The service was probably the best of any restaurant.  Our server kept the glasses full and anticipated our every need.  Kudos to California Pizza!!

P3V_SN0D_GoX41AqCrpGPw.text: CPK , Manager Dee and waitstaff did an exceptional job making my 13 yo daughter's birthday party a HUGE success. Despite being very busy with the lunch crowd they accommodated us and provided great service and delicious food to celebrate. We really appreciated it! Thank you.

HKn3uZxnu4TmPgKDZlE8tQ.text: Everyone enjoyed their meal and commented on how the loved it. One person had a split pea soup.  Another the Chopped Salad.    For me, I always get the Avacado Rolls and love them.  Not so much this time. I'd have to reconsider ordering them. I don't know what changed- whether it was me or the meal- but we may have to break up.

9dIhxoV5LlETjpceozbS8g.text: Black Friday ...we were looking for a great dinner by ordering takeout...ordered 2 pizzas and a large Thai Salad.  One of the pizzas was basically raw...uncooked crust and raw veggies. The pizzas weren't even warm. The salad tasted like the chicken was several days old. Everything was just horrible!  Very disappointed.

Ch0Pu76me-z8FWbW5NOX5w.text: I absolutely love going to CPK! The Avocado Rolls are amazing and the Salads are great! As someone who tries to make health conscious choices when ordering from the menu yet always finds the selections unappealing, CPK's menu is like a breath of fresh air!!! The Pizza selections are great and the food is always excellent!   The staff is always extremely pleasant, probably due to the amazing leadership of management. Nina is simply AWESOME! Always fun and engaging, Nina is exceedingly personable and always makes sure you feel valued and important!

bDScKDABkO7qv_agIH3rMg.text: Still great menu, but the portions are getting smaller and smaller and the wait staff seem to be not as sharp or attentive as we are used to experiencing.  On that note, wait staff seem to have a "it is just a job" demeanor.  Greet, cover specials, take order, deliver, make one check on table, give bill, disappear.  Sad.  Perhaps this is a management issue as we have not been at another CPK location for quite some time.  The food, though, is good.  Flavorful and nicely plated.

HdJBSeBR01MAyFXrJuKjnw.text: Overpriced chain restaurant. The pizza was actually good, but so small for the price.  the salad had so much dressing on it that I couldn't finish it :( ...   Our server, Chase, was amazing though, so friendly and so helpful.

R89FVuhcXz2HgMnvzRJFgQ.text: Had a lovely time food was delicious only complaint is that the sweet tea wasn't sweet enough but then again I'm a southern gal.

GNxAyxdsqTbT6jnOfT6Iiw.text: It was just the two of us and we split a pizza - the Jamaican Jerk. Any other server would probably not give us much attention because of that. However our server Ashley B was amazing. Checked back on us a lot and refilled our water and brought us napkins and silverware without us having to ask. Pretty sure she could read our minds. We were in and out in under 30 or 45 minutes.

P6xHUBkFpx6MOH-_dOXrkw.text: I tried to just eat there with my son. I asked to be seated outside, because nobody was there and my toddler was well a toddler. Telling me it only takes like few min. Nothing happend.and than after I asked the host told me,well we have only 1 waiter. I told her I do not like to sit inside and disturb customers with my son, and she could just told me.so we walked out.

adqAE7j4WBrO_E6fWkTqAg.text: The food here is always so delicious, I had a Moroccan spiced chicken salad and a blue berry ginger smash cocktail. I eat here very often and I am always well taken care of by the staff.

w8OkwjEPTBmlmIyrKeWjKQ.text: We usually dine at this location when we visit South Park Mall and we really enjoy the food and the ambience.  Unfortunately, they missed the mark today. We came on a Sunday afternoon around 2pm as a party of 5. The hostess, "Abbey" told us it would be a 25 minute wait. As we waited, we saw other large groups get seated before us. This was infuriating to say the least. I spoke to the manager, "Bob M" who was only mildly apologetic and not concerned about the lack of hospitality.  We decided to leave and try our luck somewhere else that would value our time and money. I suggest you do the same.

yCBhqSrzN7bpArc3qjHoZg.text: I just came in for a beverage.  I had their strawberry mango cooler.It was very good. The wait staff was okay, but a bit slow.  They never came back to see if I needed anything else.  The restaurant is nice and clean.

ZrmHklt3P0Uf7p7TtnxRxA.text: I have a soft spot for the chicken Waldorf salad, but have had two frustrating experiences at this location with the same waiter. I felt like he was constantly trying to upsell us. When we asked for water, he was like ohh bottled water right? And when we ordered our food he started rattling off a bunch of appetizers saying you want one? He did this as he was leaving so we were constantly saying no no. Just the things we asked for. Don't add extra stuff onto our bill. Then when it was time for the check, he was nowhere to be found until he rolled up saying "you want dessert, right?" I realize they want you to spend more money at their establishment, but it felt like he was trying to trick us into paying for things we didn't ask for. I've had this server twice and both times it was the same experience. I haven't been back since.

Isbwd23Mcjw5MbgSI5iTIQ.text: Food was good but service kinda sucked. The sweet tea tasted like dish water. and the drinks are like $3 and some change and it sat empty half my meal and never got a refill

CPrvwMycPrCgZWAmaQyz1g.text: Waiter sneezed on our food and questioned whether we were then done with out meal. Do I like to eat snot? I think no. Coca Cola fro fountain was the highlight of the meal, and I have had better. Fried Mac and cheese was all Mac and no cheese - waste of last week's paycheck. The "pizza"(?) - I used to make better pizza in my easy bake oven. Very, very disappointing. I could see 90 corners of square American cheese that was used in lieu of the authentic pats of mozzarella promised by the embellished television ads. My final point is, be True to who you are. My son Gavin's 8th birthday was a disappointment, and he takes it out on his dad, not CPK.

UNSil8kXO322B2Kle_xPAw.text: The reason why this place would even get stars is because our waiter was so sweet. Ordered the Thai chicken pizza on thin crust and it came back to us looking like burnt toast. It was so hard to chew my mouth got tired. Our spinach and artichoke dip was so watery and the Mac and cheese bites or balls were also over cooked and bland. Definitely should've gone elsewhere.

7LlgdEIbu3X58kh4BLNz2Q.text: I order delivery from here weekly. It's the only place I can eat pizza with cauliflower crust from, considering my food sensitivities. With that said, I'm no longer a customer. Twice now they've added chicken to my spinach/artichoke pizza. I choose not to eat chicken because I can't eat chicken-unless I want a whole host of horrible reactions to occur to my body. Why would you add chicken to a pizza that doesn't include it and the customer hasn't asked for it???

T-MlZ1SlruwNnfpp95nW_g.text: The food delicious, our waiter was great. However the hostees tried to sit us in a hidden booth by a table with dirty dishes. It was an area that employees gathered. I asked her is there a reason we past SEVERAL empty tables in the front of the restaurant. She escorted us to a proper seating area. This location is in South Park Mall and is a causal place.

qE_GvWYT-0Xi5wm-xQ-Epg.text: This is probably the best place to get a salad.  I always come here for lunch or dinner and I get the Chinese Chopped Chicken Salad with the Red Berry Sangria.   The salad is so filling, bursting with flavor and I get the half portion. The half portion is way more than enough for one person.   The sangria is to die for. So flavorful and the portion is huge for a great price.   The customer service is great, everyone is friendly and I get my foods and drinks fairly quick for how busy they are!

photos.caption: Photo of California Pizza Kitchen at Southpark Mall - Charlotte, NC, United States

qkuRt9B_RrgAKkR6e8w9XA.text: Terrible/ super slow service. The restaurant had approximately 5 tables sat and STILL, we waited 30 min for just our salads. Our entrees came out slow as well, and cold af! Absolutely terrible experience. Staff was wandering around aimlessly, and often seen congregating and shooting the shit. Just bad all around.

AUthuuKOQ9iQRAHFKl0BKA.text: Decent pizza. Bartender should not ever touch my olives with their hands. Right?? Don't like seeing a bus bin sitting next to me for 45 mins. MOST RESTAURANTS DONT EVEN USE THESE.

photos.caption: Photo of California Pizza Kitchen at Southpark Mall - Charlotte, NC, United States

ZNZnD1OLqu3spToEiNMt0A.text: Not sure why CPK has three stars.  We come here often and always enjoy our food and experience great service.  Today we had the Hawaiian pizza, spinach and arugula salad, mushroom flatbread and the tortilla spring rolls.  Everything was excellent.  The best part was the service we received by Jane who took our carry out order.  We highly recommend this CPK location.  Enjoy!

xQQj-W4MZULW0fxNC6kFmw.text: I've been here at least three times the past few years and I really enjoyed this place. Each time I go there the food has been consistently good. So far, I like their Sicilian Pizza and Caribbean Jerk pizza. Also, their red velvet cake is scrumptious. I can't wait to come back soon.

H0aInN9PYLF0Q3bO5Z8ByA.text: Terrible experience. The Halibut was severely overcooked cooked & the farro was cold. The mushroom pizza with the cauliflower crust had a terrible after taste.  We had quite possibly the worse waitress in the world. She gave zero service, we had to ask for bread & silverware (who can eat without silverware). Our dishes were dirty.  Our waitress seemed annoyed when we asked for lemon for the water & tea. We were harrassed with the waitresses urgency for us to pay & leave. She must have come to take our money four times in 7 mins (harrassed us to hurry & pay). Never going back. Do yourself a favor & skip this place.  You deserve 0 stars!

iUBRmIUKboXaYc474vQKew.text: I asked my wife what she wanted for lunch last weekend.  "Well... I really want the Thai chicken egg rolls from CPK, but we hate the one here in Charlotte..."  After debating it for a bit and being unable to come up with something else that would satisfy her taste craving, we both decided to give it another try.  We were both surprised for the better.  I'm betting that there was a management change somewhere in the past year as this place seems to have turned around.  The glass and doors were clean of fingerprints (pretty good given it was 2pm on a Saturday, after a lunch rush) and the greeters were friendly.  The waiter missed a drink order, but when I reminded him he quickly apologized, made a joke and came running w/ the drinks.  Our salad was cold and crisp.  The food was hot and fresh and I was particularly happy with a California Veggie Pizza that had several types of vegetables on it.  I hesitated to order it as they different veg would require different levels of cooking to get to a good finished product but the kitchen staff pulled it off beautifully.  It was delicious.  I'll bump 'em up to 4 stars for now and will probably be back in the future.

Q7Sr67iS7Q_X7H_PzDYNSA.text: Food is pretty good here, but this was not a good experience.  I picked my daughter up from school for lunch to celebrate getting into her first choice for college and thought we could order as takeout and ask if we could actually dine in so it would be ready when we got there. When we got there, we discovered that the restaurant wasn't open yet and we waited.  They were a few minutes late opening so the restaurant was completely empty.  I asked for a manager so we could see if we could dine in, since we were now starting to run low on time.  She responded by saying that take out was  for take out and that she could do it THIS time since it was slow.  The tone was condescending and she informed me that they do it that way because servers depend on tips.  I told her that was why I was asking BEFORE I paid for the meal so we could tip.  It was entirely too much drama so early in the morning.  Managers need to be trained to solve problems and not create them.  Your restaurant is completely empty and you act like it's a bother to seat me for lunch, when 'm stating that I have no problem tipping.  That just makes no sense...    The simple way to handle this would have been to say, "Sure, I can transfer your ticket to a table ticket and have one of our servers take care of you."

photos.caption: Photo of California Pizza Kitchen at Southpark Mall - Charlotte, NC, United States. Completely empty..:

0X4jPFx2O_Xeql_dlqwzUA.text: The bartender and staff were very friendly.  The decor is kind of like a diner in a weird way.  Not attractive an attractive or ambient space at all.  The food is California Pizza Kitchen so you know what you're getting.  The food is consistent.

J1S-JcsqtLA9GSgByTLejw.text: This place is ridiculous! The service is terrible but I have to say the pizza is usually really good...the only reason we keep going back. The staff serving the customers just doesn't seem to be trained. Sometimes they seem to be clueless!! If they had good service the place would be packed but that never seems to be the case.  We might not go back and instead drive a little further to Mellow Mushroom.

jAoSg11q3r8yknCL32kw-g.text: Probably one of the best pizzas I've ever had growing up. The original barbecue chicken pizza is hands down the best pizza I've had. The Thai chicken is second to that. Really love the pizza that they make here.

suXjl-94UQc7eHtXob6Wvg.text: Even though lots of these reviews seem negative, I had a pleasant experience back in November when I visited.   The restaurant was completely crowded, so my party of 5 sat at the bar. Our server took a little while at first, but he was obviously very busy with bartending and such. I ordered the Berry Sangria and it was delish, one of the best sangrias I have had. For dinner, I tried their new Wild Mushroom Strozzapreti pasta, and it was just phenomenal. I am a huge mushroom fan and the past was cooked very well.  While our meal was being served, the manager came over and spoke to us. She was very knowledgeable and displayed great customer service. We ended the meal with the Butter Cake and the Chocolate Souffle Cake. Both were very tasty.   I look forward to returning tomorrow afternoon for my next business trip to Charlotte!

521CyOwm_QeDoHQAkBVTOg.text: When you eat here, expect to feel as if you a bother to the employees. My friend and I ate here on a Sunday afternoon for lunch and sadly I believe it will be my last visit.  The host area is unorganized and unattended. After another employee got the host a few ppl ahead of got seated and then we did. Upon being seated it took several minutes for the waitress to show up. (& it was not slammed, so being busy isn't an excuse)  Her demeanor and attitude was very unfriendly. Her service was poor. Meaning the amount of time it took to get our good and drinks, never once got a refill, and taking awhile to process our checks.  The only ounce of friendliness was when she dripped the checks off BC she was thinking about us tipping.  She acted like she hated being there.  And the the same attitude with the food runner.   The food itself was ok. I got the chicken wrap app as a meal and my friend got a salad. But in my opinion it's over priced for mediocre food and bad service. Do yourself a favor, save time and money and go to the food court instead.

E5OBZ_04024qQ3BfaF-vyQ.text: Errr,, ummm,,, I'm definitely struggling for words here. I'm trying to comprehend how the pioneer of the Buffalo chicken pizza is now serving uninspired,  lackluster pizzas. Every time I took a bite out of my Thai Chicken and The Works pizza, I'm a bit dumbfounded how a popular place like this can serve severely bland tasting pizzas.     The food was so blah,, we ended up playing the "would you rather..." game.     A: Would you rather eat pizza from CPK or Pizza Hut?    B: Pizza Hut!!     A: Would you rather eat pizza from CPK or Little Caesars?     B: Little Caesars!!  Yes, it was that bad. I don't know if these guys are actually tasting their food, but whoever the head chef/cook in that establishment should definitely invest in some tastebuds.     Lowest rating would be a one star, but the extra star is for their service,,, the host seated us right away, we received our waters,, ordered our drinks and food in a timely fashion. Our server was on point and we were well taken cared of. Even my beer came frosty cold.   It's such a shame that amidst all that stellar service,, the quality of food eclipsed all their hard work. This CPK sorta did it for me, it'll probably take a bit til I step into one of these joints again. Hopefully it's not the case in other CPKs.     Weeeeeeeeeee

photos.caption: Photo of California Pizza Kitchen at Southpark Mall - Charlotte, NC, United States. (&#34;,)
Photo of California Pizza Kitchen at Southpark Mall - Charlotte, NC, United States. (&#34;,)

1rSclt9mT33WabMJG6cYsw.text: Ive been here a few times but surprised at rating.  Ive never had a problem and tonight no different.   Fast friendly service and good food

photos.caption: Photo of California Pizza Kitchen at Southpark Mall - Charlotte, NC, United States. 5 chesse with tomato

u2qtw1z8ZXI7bpWZE58ecA.text: Casual feel and mid level pricing make this a fun option. Pizzas are good and range in styles and ethnicities. Many dishes are seasonal and the menus change frequently. Service at the SouthPark location is generally good to excellent pending the time you dine. The Pizza dough rewards app makes dining more fun here and offers tons of benefits like mobile pay, coupons and points towards food.

L75MbrpH-tdR-Kk5NkrEMg.text: This place is in the mall, so stopped in to give my credit card a breather. Sat at the bar. Bartender Eva got to me immediately. I ordered water with cucumber, not your usual water with lemon. She kindly shaved me some cucumber. When I asked what's the Spiked Cucumber, she gave me full description and made it just as I requested. When I ordered my garden salad and asked for basic Italian dressing, she suggested an awesome lemon vinaigrette. For my entree I went with Shrimp Scampi Zucchini. Maybe I missed the description on the menu, but I was not aware it came with linguini, pasta I did not need. I told her I could pick around it, but she insisted and had a pasta free dish made. Her only goal was seeing me smile.  It's service like this you expect when you go out to enjoy a meal. No, it's not Spago or Nobu, but service is key no matter where you're dining.   Good food, but 5 stars go to Eva!

photos.caption: Photo of California Pizza Kitchen at Southpark Mall - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp Scampi Linguini
Photo of California Pizza Kitchen at Southpark Mall - Charlotte, NC, United States. Half Garden Salad
Photo of California Pizza Kitchen at Southpark Mall - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spiked Cucumber

PP8aTaxm_iSpDghEvNFhHg.text: They have a nice patio that theoretically one can sit at with multiple families and let the kids play in the park right off the patio.    But, the service and management is too poor to consistently allow people on the patio.  We have tried multiple times and have always been denied.      This is the type of thing that has moved me from about a once a month family dinner with CPK now I simply will never spend dollars at CPK again.    Hopefully someone at corporate reads these reviews and can execute better service and decisions for those still spending dollars at CPK

RYH5L9HAg66Zb-aqieW0ug.text: My wife and I ate here yesterday after a photo shoot in South Park. We had a great experience, the server was polite and attentive and we were sat immediately upon arriving.   The food was delicious and came quickly. I forgot what my wife ordered, but I got a Thin Crust Sicilian pizza. Boy was it good! It was pretty big as well, we both ate only half of our order and ate the rest for dinner that night.   I would definitely recommend this place, nice family atmosphere, great food and nice people serving you. Thanks!

photos.caption: Photo of California Pizza Kitchen at Southpark Mall - Charlotte, NC, United States. Delicious Thin Crust Sicilian Pizza

6wRCvEx7eU0YIK2okVx_SA.text: Food was good when we got it. It seems to be par for the course every time we come it's slow, no mater the time of day.

UTwpGX11iZImLBXiwR76Hg.text: Love the pizzas here. My favorite is Jamaican Jerk. Crispy mac n cheese is one more perfect small plate dish. It is in the mall, so we visit this place very often. They serve awesome coolers, which are really cool if you are just coming on hot sunny day or tired after shopping in the mall. Service could get a little better and attentive, but I assume it is so because it is often a busy place being in a mall.

-Up73WstTQoCQyQDtX2C4Q.text: Average visit to CPK  ORDERED:  The Original BBQ Chicken Pizza : A :)  Drinks : Fresh Strawberry Mango Cooler : First Attempt: F, Second Attempt: A Sparkling Berry-Lemon : C   Service : Sweet waitress, helpful to fix each issue, not served in a timely manner. C+   Negatives: Not offered complimentary bread, one of the serving dishes arrived at table dirty.

photos.caption: Photo of California Pizza Kitchen at Southpark Mall - Charlotte, NC, United States. Plate

1ZlJkTKHBilVdHq5oNv6WA.text: We had a great meal here and I am in love with their avacado egg rolls! The steak was delicious and a fun ambiance.

photos.caption: Photo of California Pizza Kitchen at Southpark Mall - Charlotte, NC, United States

8Pn-t5rmG37e5hbg--zSjg.text: I must say they are not just Pizza. there are variety other options- flat bread, salad, soups. I have tried the original BBQ pizza, Chipotle chicken pizza and the Thai pizza so far. All are good but on our recent visit I felt the Chipotle chicken pizza was a bit burnt on the lower side on the edge. We also ordered "Mexican sweet corn" and "chicken Flatbread"from the options for small plates+Flatbread. The Flatbread seemed dry. I liked the cranberry juice.

photos.caption: Photo of California Pizza Kitchen at Southpark Mall - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sweet corn and chicken Flatbread
Photo of California Pizza Kitchen at Southpark Mall - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cranberry juice
Photo of California Pizza Kitchen at Southpark Mall - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chipotle chicken pizza

JtJ3NO08-HMA8TwXNiMnZQ.text: Conveniently located in the SouthPark mall with both interior and exterior entrances. The employees were friendly and patient as we took a while to decide what to order since I was on a business lunch and we were chatting. In an effort to be environmentally friendly, the waitress asked if anyone wanted a straw instead of making the assumption and leaving them for the whole table. She brought bread with a dipping oil - in which I ate all four pieces cause it was really good and I was starving. For lunch, I ordered the bbq chicken chopped salad which had a great mixture of greens, beans, corn and chicken. Lots of flavors and textures to make for a great nutritious lunch! I would definitely get that again.

photos.caption: Photo of California Pizza Kitchen at Southpark Mall - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bread and dipping oil
Photo of California Pizza Kitchen at Southpark Mall - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ chicken chopped salad

sP34HxCZCf4IyR9pfvLDgg.text: I used to be a huge lover of CPK. But it's been a while since I've visited a location and I must say this visit didn't impress me at all.   We arrived on Sunday afternoon and the place wasn't too packed. Our waitress arrived and welcomed us and before we could ask any questions she let us know what they were out of...Hmmm okay. Why are you out of so many options? Especially the specials?   They didn't have several of the special items, some salads or pizzas. That was a bit frustrating. I ended up ordering the wedge salad and the carne asada pizza.   The wedge salad was a huge disappointment. The iceberg lettuce was brown, the presentation was awful and the dressing had a bit of an aftertaste. I would not recommend.   The pizza was very underwhelming. It lacked flavor and for the price I expected so much more. The menu boasts of an awesome combination of flavors which include tender marinated steak, fire-roasted poblanos, cilantro pesto, yellow onions, mozzarella, monterey Jack and fresh cilantro. Served with a side of housemade salsa verde.  What we got was tough steak, salsa verde which lacked flavor and the crust was a bit wet and soft on the bottom. Not a fan.   I'll pass on the next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of California Pizza Kitchen at Southpark Mall - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of California Pizza Kitchen at Southpark Mall - Charlotte, NC, United States

2O8ePvsZ0GJXzFfXqfGOyw.text: Their menu is quire large. I had to narrow down my selections in order to determine what I wanted for lunch. You can either go super healthy or indulge in a heavy pasta dish that is sure to fill you up. I loved the layout of their restaurant. Our server was not over pushy when I could not decide on what I wanted but yet she helped me determine my order. Though it did take a while for our food, our waters were always filled. Our dishes were incredibly tasty.

iTbmnRMWTz_zRIhqrqJ6_g.text: I first went to a CPK when I lived in Portland, OR and there are none in New Orleans where I now live. So when I saw this in the South Park mall with my parents, I knew where I was dragging them for lunch. We were not disappointed.  The wait staff were friendly to my parents and bent over backwards to make sure all of their needs were met. All 3 of us got the lunch special of a salad and individual pizza. Everything was so fresh. The entire restaurant was neat and clean. The restrooms were clean and well stocked.  I would recommend to anyone shopping the mall or in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of California Pizza Kitchen at Southpark Mall - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu near entrance to CPK
Photo of California Pizza Kitchen at Southpark Mall - Charlotte, NC, United States. Entrance
Photo of California Pizza Kitchen at Southpark Mall - Charlotte, NC, United States. Women&#39;s restroom.

5h64iPFkc0EblmTpsOh6uA.text: Worst customer experience I've ever had. Served cold food, waiting over 15 minutes for menu, bad attitude waitresses. Last time for us, and you choose a different place

ZTQz_hPu6sJ_WKiBny44QQ.text: Ridiculously slow to receive food after ordering. No wait on a Saturday evening but over 45 minutes to get meals.  Server never apologized or let us know the food was taking so long. Food was decent once finally arriving. Asked for check and also took a long time. Drinks never refilled.

CS_R1wiayctMphJnXKFLGg.text: I am a strong advocate of service. No matter how the good food is.Our server might had a rough day, but service was quite dry. I truly understand that it was crowded, but you need to be attentive to your guests. Small things like straw and repeating the order matters.  Now coming to food, Thai Salad and spicy chipotle pizza was the highlight

photos.caption: Photo of California Pizza Kitchen at Southpark Mall - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of California Pizza Kitchen at Southpark Mall - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of California Pizza Kitchen at Southpark Mall - Charlotte, NC, United States

RqTwJz-0CMj2fyVqtIYAdw.text: The wait was the only negative. Our waiter Eli made the visit worth the wait. I would highly recommend. My boyfriend and I lacked for nothing. The pizza was fresh and hot.

2XG6h0-0Zr7WHI14ndVcMQ.text: I just love California Pizza Kitchens. Their service is always excellent. The food is superior. My favorite is the smashed pea soup and cucumber refresher. This is really my favorite chain restaurant.

8ifvSIOQHJh1f8wtzXXQdQ.text: Consistently the most over cooked, overpriced pizza I have ever had.  My jaw gets tired chewing it and my teeth crack on the crust.  They dole out Ranch dressing like it was more expensive than printer ink.

w-Vu6mxN77zlbNYRFzKtNw.text: If your thinking this is just a typical pizza spot then your terribly wrong. It's so much more and the service is quick and friendly. My fiancee and I went here and had the $35 special. It included a tasty pizza and bunch of other delights. We were so stuffed. We also finished off the night with a butter cake. I had the 'itis' after this if you know what I mean. I immediately went to nap. Try this spot out. You won't regret.

Q22hs1Bxra8N1LSQE7fvog.text: Picked up my free birthday dessert - salted caramel pudding. Delish. The curbside pickup is a pain in the butt to find, though. It's in the parking deck near Macy's by the CATS bus stop.

N01kBU7oCmT5CFNaNRu8Pg.text: Just had the worst experience at CPK in Charlotte. We used to be frequent customers, will never return. Still have not even heard from them after writing to them explaining my situation. The manager here is AWFUL! Ruined a 5 year olds birthday and was completely rude and arrogant!

cZ_YcqyS4cYWy3Lkd7a9Vg.text: CPK is definitely one of those places I don't go often, but I have never had a bad meal here so I would never hesitate to stop in.  Some times I find myself craving a bowl of the tortilla soup, its really good.  My favorite pizza here is the cheeseburger with avocado on top.  Everything on this pizza just works great together and its a nice alternative to my usual fave of getting NY style pizza in Charlotte.  I could name a bunch of other pizzas that I am a fan of, but there are too many to list.  Oh and the hummus appetizer is also really great served with plenty of warm toasted pita points!

BETZ-0yTQFy3xWzY5-sNZQ.text: Okay, Yes, I'm another teenager who hangs out at Southpark Mall, BUT I actually buy stuff and do more than crawl around Abercrombie looking trendy. I ate here 2 days ago with a friend of mine and I was shocked at the prices. Now I understand, Southpark is for the premium crowd, but its a bit insane to charge 15 bucks for a pasta dish. My friend and I ended up ordering children's pizzas (6 bucks for 4 microscopic pieces of mediocre pizza, yay) and the service was very average, and continued to get worse with the less money we spent. Yes, I am a teenager, but my money counts also and I am their future customer....well actually, no, I will never be a future customer at California Pizza Kitchen.

uD6wsTOiKxP5pznoJNwCpA.text: Food is always good, service is hit or miss. Prices are high. Nothing special. Salads are creative and fresh.

bfqGb-uhAZXEenaNBMfbkQ.text: went here today for lunch. i love California pizza but for some reason i was not feeling it today. not only was the service was bad but they also sat me in a bad place (too small table)  and to top it off now my stomach hurts:/

0pW7qzM57nHgcdeWGUw-EQ.text: California Pizza Kitchen is conveniently located in South Park Mall. It is an ideal place to rest your feet after shopping.   I went in the late afternoon and had prompt service. The server was attentive, but seemed distracted by multi-tasking.   I ordered the goat cheese and rosted red pepper pizza. It was very flavorful! My husband ordered the Mediterranean salad and it was good too.   I tend to enjoy non-chain restaurants more than chains, but California Pizza Kitchen did the trick. Like I mentioned before, it's a great way to rest and eat after walking around the mall.

1wRhP7AqIauAcpbv_KTPuQ.text: Amazing pasta that's full of flavor and texture to the tee!! The pizza ain't too bad here either with a staff that's always courteous and friendly... Well laid out restaraunt overall with a decent sized patio

4vpvlTG_Vx8NtFlYXeERvg.text: My wife and I decided to try out California Pizza Kitchen for lunch to day when walked in we were greeted by the hostess and seated quickly.  A few minutes later out server came over took our drink orders brought them back quickly and took our food orders, I ordered the wild mushroom pizza and my wife ordered  the the 5 cheese and fresh tomato pizza and a petite wedge salad.   30 minutes passed and  no signs of the salad or entrees we got up and left so I can;t even comment on the food as we never even got any save for the limes in my wife's club soda. Probably won't come back here again since wasted time can't be refunded.

vwrahv9Woxgmk_gzkWRWrw.text: The food is pretty good here. It was two of us and we decided to share the spicy chicken tinga quesadilla and they were awesome! also, we shared the California club pizza and we LOVED it. When we go back that's what we usually get. Although, the service isn't that great.. Past times I've gone server never came and we ended up leaving. Hostess begged us to stay but we had already decided on a new restaurant. Food is good. Service is eh.

5Bh_yZAcfgbJcTuocFaAig.text: I hate to write a negative review. I hate to be negative period. But this place was really really disappointing. CPK used to be my favorite restaurant in Cali. I would always go there and order the same thing Tortilla soup and the greek pizza. Once in a while, when I felt adventurous, I would try something new.   However, this place was not the same. The tortilla soup was probably the only good thing I had. The greek pizza was ok and the hawaiian pizza was so bad that I could not believe it was even on the menu. It was dry and looked unappealing. Dominos makes a better hawaiian! Gosh that was harsh but I was really disappointed.   The service was not that great either. Our waitress was not very attentive and we had to ask her several times for things since she would forget. When ordering beer she had no idea which beer was which to her credit she was under 21 but she didn't even offer to check. It was just an overall bad experience. Maybe it was a bad day for CPK but I doubt I will return. Too disappointing.

IMzFuACvHhqVJ7PiDlEK8A.text: I am a longtime fan of CPK and have eaten at this CPK dozens of times over the past several years.  The food and service have generally, if not consistently, been good and the management is generally visible and engaged.  Unfortunately, as others have noted, this locations does seem to have some issues, one of which being that they make a horrible first impression.  The behavior and treatment from the hostess stand toward customers has become intolerable and resulted in us leaving without eating on our most recent visit.

WIJc4Ktfn7llcSg5HhTGTw.text: File this under another safe place I can meet my parents for lunch.  Their pizzas are decent, and pizza is generally a pretty good choice for vegetarians since there's lots of variety.  In addition, they have a Thai crunch salad that I've enjoyed, along with a host of vegetarian soups (seriously, if you can't at least make your soups vegetarian, what hope is there?)...  I find the menu a bit overpriced, and I doubt I would ever come here on my own; however, I'm always happy to find another restaurant that serves more for me than just a Caesar salad, hold the chicken.

65vbZwExjJ5Kjlw3t4P-yw.text: Slow service. Management lacks leadership. Other than that, the food is on par with the high quality standards of all the other CPK stores.

yKuUcLyEbdhm5m-6ho_K6Q.text: Guess there's a reason it's not called the California Chicken/Pasta Kitchen. Ordered a chicken pasta dish and asked if they offered a half portion option... the answer was unfortunately "No." Full order came, but only 5 to 6 thumb size pieces of meat. No where near enough for a $12+ meal. Server responded by bringing over the manager; he explained how the meal was prepared, but did agree to have some extra chicken grilled up and brought over at no charge.

xEX5kGaABSinQ_I_OXFWDA.text: The wait staff was nice, The service was good, The food was as good as it always is at CPK. If you like CPK.. You will like it here

W7AqtBXoivdF7gwHpzUyng.text: Kudos to California Pizza Kitchen for opening outside seating just for us to accommodate mom's wheelchair!!!  Awesome service and yummy food.

sgpFVs2Wms_0OXuaRo_ndw.text: The food is delicious but the service has never been good.   One night, my date (who is lactose intolerant) asked for a salad sans cheese. The salad had to go back three times before they got it right. My pizza was cold before my date could even eat.  Another night I received a beer with a huge chunk of slushy ice in it. This was after clarifying our order twice, as the waiters don't like to write things down.   My verdict: if you want CPK, get takeout.

jEFF6e4GPfI7EtuyD-EO0g.text: I've been to California Pizza Kitchen in TX and GA and usually I have a good meal however I wanted pasta this time and the server convinced me that the Chicken Tequila Fettuccine was delicious. Well the sauce and spinach fettuccine was great but the chicken was dry and left a lot to be desired.  Next time I will stick with real tequila and a pizza please!

s9b9lg08gI8JGe0s5Ex4_A.text: The meal that I had was the worst meal that I have had in years and as I was leaving, I gave the Server a very small tip in cash (2.00) and told her.  She said that she would let the manager know. I ordered the Fish Tacos- the fish was dry tasteless, tough red cabbage, too much ranchito sauce. I ordered the White Wine Flight (which has one of my favorite Wines, Nobilo- it tasted like vinegar). I finished the Riesling but could not finish the Nobilo or the Chardonnay (horrible aftertaste).   The Server, Susan  came by to ask about my meal after I had pushed it to the end of the table, barely half eaten. I told her that it was just ok.  She said that the Salmon was better and left to continue working.   Susan came back before I left to ask if I wanted anything else.  I regret that I did not ask to speak with the manager.  I should have also asked that at least the wine be taken off of my bill.  I wasted $25.00.  I do not plan on eating at CPK again.  I also plan on telling everyone that I know about this experience.  I will not recommend CPK for dining.

tCfx0InRU__PQia6t1qXKg.text: Mariana rocked our weekend. We ordered something that was not per our expectations so she took it off for us without a hint to us. She knows customer service and front line associate power. This is one well managed crew!

Rk4JSvtr9tpf6_0p4FzYYA.text: Forget this place! There are too many other choices in Charlotte to pay for bad food and bad service. It's a typical 'mall restaurant.'

I5_rcxpTPWG97IM5SDxDiw.text: Been to this location plenty of times and never had a complaint but after today, I may never return.  The appetizers we ordered came promptly. However, the spinach artichoke dip was room temperature instead of hot. After flagging down the waiter (since he never checked in on us) he quickly got it heated. Then the main course of barbecue chicken pizza came. It tasted quite great.  While talking with my company, the waiter came, and instead of refilling my drink that had been empty for quite some time, he took my lat piece of pizza and the spinach artichoke dip away without asking if I was finished or if I wanted a box! (Which I did as I was still eating the pizza and planned on boxing the dip).  He then finally refilled my drink- halfway. That was the cherry on top-- after the whole mess of a night he only refilled my drink half way even though he had an entire pitcher at his disposal.  I will be avoiding a return to this location due to this visit.

dyxZEYBNSnYEAm3aAoc1QA.text: In general I really enjoy CPK. This visit the only thing I didn't enjoy was that the place has two entrances and the hostess had some difficulty determining who came in first (even though we were very polite when telling her that we had come in ahead of another group) they were on her list first so they got seated first. If a place has two entrances and they are getting busy, its a good idea to establish a line and stick to it. The only reason we were there was because our first choice restaurant had a 2.5 hour wait and CPK only had a 30 min wait. Anyways, once we were seated everything was good. Our server Elisabeth was great. We had the Focaccia bread and the Fried Macaroni small plate as our appetizers. The bread was good and the mac was ok. The breading on the mac was delicious the mac in itself was a bit lacking in flavor. We had three pizzas at our table - The Meat Cravers on orig crust, Jamaica Jerk Chicken thin crust, and Hawaiian BBQ. The Jamaican Jerk was spicy but very tasty! All three were really good. The flavored lemonades and teas were good. All in all, we had a good experience. Standard CPK from what we've experienced. Good food and good service and reasonably priced. Random - I Love their to go pizza box instructions!

QFjoVvtURCnNtnv8Qt10RA.text: It was two days before Christmas and total chaos everywhere except here! Service was excellent, the food was outstanding! My husband and I started with the Mediterranean small bites then each had a pizza. I love their whole wheat crust!  Service was fantastic too!

oEjlsnLh2aAPwQ_8KxLd-Q.text: The food wasn't that good, the pizza was way to thin and it taste like wood. Also the bread appetiser was way to cooked and in the salad was chicken skin. Disgusting I'm never going back there. But the service was good.
